io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x

Class BuilderServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.AbstractService
      • io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.BuilderServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BuilderService

    public class BuilderServiceImpl
extends AbstractService
implements BuilderService

    Our implementation of the builder service. The indexing is done in a background task, in a thread-safe manner.

    While clients may call the index(SourceDataSet, IndexMonitor) method concurrently, it is not recommended, because each call is allocated the same threading profile, which could result in too many threads being allocated when the profile isn't defined in regards of how many concurrent calls there may be.

    • Method Detail

      • index

        public void index(SourceDataSet dataSet,
         IndexMonitor monitor)
           throws BuildException
        Description copied from interface: BuilderService
        Requests an index construction. Implementations are encouraged to use a new thread for the construction, as indexing may take many minutes, depending on the volume of data to be indexed.
        Specified by:
        index in interface BuilderService
        Parameters:
        dataSet - Set of game data to be indexed.
        monitor - Implementations should provide feedback on the construction, using a dedicated build monitor (a visitor), so that clients may report the construction progress as needed.
        Throws:
        BuildException - When the process fails.
